revised_title: On the Correlation of Characters Not Quantitatively Measurable in Evolution
tldr: This article presents a new method for calculating the correlation of characters not quantitatively measurable, such as coat color in horses and eye color in humans. The author uses a simple differential relation to expand the coefficients of correlation and create a symbolic operator that converts an uncorrelated surface of frequency into a correlated surface with coefficients of arbitrary values. The author also introduces new functions called "-functions" that satisfy a difference equation and can be used to calculate the volume of a frequency surface.
